description.narrative: The project has a two-pronged development objective: (i) improving irrigation service delivery and water management for the benefit of a sustainable increase in irrigated agricultural productivity; and (ii) improving national water resource governance for the benefit of water users and the nation as a whole.

condition.narrative: Conducive legislation concerning water resources management and setting of irrigation fees shall be in place.
The Recipient shall maintain the National Water Council (NWC) which will provide policy guidance and oversight of the activitiesunder Part B of the Project.
The Recipient, through DWR, shall maintain, throughout the Project execution, the WUA SUs established under the IDA's On-FarmIrrigation Project.
The Recipient, through DWR, shall prepare and furnish to IDA for its prior review and approval, a design report for each off-farmirrigation system or irrigation dam.

title.narrative: SWA functions, staffing and budgets prepared and submitted to Ministry of Finance.

target.value: SWA functions, staffing and budgets approved by gov’t

actual.value: SWA functions, staffing and budgets prepared.

comment.narrative: Approval of SWA staffing and budgets by gov't will be addressed under the follow-up NWRMP-1.

title.narrative: Increase in crop production by at least 10 percent within four years after rehabilitation of the project schemes.

target.value: 2.5% in schemes completed in Y6, 5% in schemes completed in Y5, 7.5% in schemes completed in Y4, 10% in schemes completed in Y3.

comment.narrative: Survey results of 19 WUAs (of which 6 rehabilitated under OIP-1 or OIP-2) in the command area of 6 off-farm schemes rehabilitatedunder the WMIP in 2010, show that irrigated area increased from 18267 to 18345 ha (0.5%). Yield per ha changes are less evident,with significant increase (80%) in fodder crops, and decrease in cotton (5%) and vegetables (22%). Most notable change is adecrease in the area of winter wheat (-15%) to an increase towards more intensive irrigated crops. Therefore, preliminary resultsare mildly positive, but further analysis for the ICRR will provide clarity,

title.narrative: Project management capacity in implementing agency enhanced and project implemention schedule adhered to
Water users provided with irrigation and drainage services - female (number)

comment.narrative: 12 % of total number of water users

title.narrative: Water users provided with new/improved irrigation and drainage services (number)

comment.narrative: Water users and their household members
12000 users in 3 schemes remaining to complete rehabilitation.

title.narrative: At least 80 percent of the project schemes judged to be properly operated and maintained following completion of rehabilitation works.

comment.narrative: 15 schemes completed, 3 schemes to be completed by end November 2013. Survey results of 19 WUAs in the command area of 6 schemesrehabilitated in 2010, show that water supply increased from 115 to 129 MCM per year, indicating that they are properly operated.However, expenditures on maintenance for 4 pilot schemes show that they are around 25% of what is required. Since no improvementsto maintenance procedures were achieved under Component 2, currently it is expected that none of the rehabilitated schemes will beproperly maintained.

title.narrative: System readiness to supply the requested volumes of water at WUA offtakes (number of systems)

comment.narrative: 3 schemes to be completed by November 2013.

title.narrative: Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)

comment.narrative: According to design documentation
3 schemes with additional 9,000 ha to be completed by end November 2013.

title.narrative: Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)

comment.narrative: According to design documentation
3 schemes with additional 9,000 ha to be completed by end November 2013.

title.narrative: Operational water user associations created and/or strengthened (number)

comment.narrative: 58 WUAs in rehabilitated irrigation schemes.
8 WUAs in 3 schemes remaining to complete rehabilitation.

title.narrative: Number of WUAs receiving water at the requested level in each period of delivery each year.

comment.narrative: Additional 4 WUAs will receive once all schemes completed by November 2013. Survey results of 19 WUAs in the command area of 6schemes rehabilitated in 2010, show that 10% have unsatisfactory supply following rehabilitation.

title.narrative: Disbursement Rate - percentage of approved budget

comment.narrative: Project is projected to fully disburse.

title.narrative: Collection rates at least 90 percent of agreed tariff (based on annual O&M plan) within two years after completion of the project schemes’ rehabilitation works

comment.narrative: Survey results of 19 WUAs (6 rehabilitated, 13 not rehabilitated) in the command area of 6 off-farm schemes rehabilitated in 2010,show that collection by the DWRLI of the agreed ISF increased from 74% before rehabilitation to 89% after rehabilitation. However,ISF-level are not set at levels sufficient for adequate O&M according to annual O&M plan. Partially achieved.

title.narrative: No. of WUA federations which have signed an agreement with the RDWR on the transfer of MOM responsibility for off-farm systems.
Number of WUA Federations which have prepared business plans, taken ownership of maintenance equipment and machinery with effectiveoperation.
Evidence of high satisfaction rates among water users with the performance of the bulk water supply agency (DWR)

target.value: High evidence of satisfaction (at least 80 percent of users satisfied).

comment.narrative: At least 80% of users satisfied

Survey results of 19 WUAs in the command area of 6 schemes rehabilitated in 2010, show that prior to rehabilitation, 68% weresatisfied, and following rehabilitation, 84% of water users were satisfied with bulk water supply,
Implementation of MOM plans for 6 pilot schemes will be supported under the NWRMP-1.

title.narrative: Institutional structure for IWRM established and functioning with approved National Water Strategy and river basin plans.

actual.value: Mandate for SWA given to DWRLI, two pilot RBCs established, approved Roadmap in lieu of National Water Strategy, and approvedriverbasin plans.

comment.narrative: In consultation with the task team there was consensus that the Roadmap for development of the water sector is for the momentpreferable over a National Water Strategy, compiled on the basis of an incomplete database.

title.narrative: National Water Strategy prepared and submitted to the NWC.

target.value: National Water Strategy revised and submitted to NWC.

comment.narrative: National Water Strategy has been revised and will be submitted to the NWC.

title.narrative: Procedures for accounting and assessing performance at scheme level identified, tested and accepted by DWR.

target.value: Procedures for accounting and assessing performance at scheme level accepted by DWR

actual.value: Procedures for accounting and assessing performance at scheme level accepted by DWRLI

comment.narrative: Procedures are being applied but have not been formally accepted by the DWRLI.

title.narrative: Government resolution on the temporary delegation of SWA authority to the DWR.

target.value: Delegation of SWA authority to DWRLI approved by gov’t

actual.value: Delegation of SWA authority to DWRLI approved by gov’t

title.narrative: Roadmap for implementation of the Water Code prepared, submitted to NWC and approved

target.value: Roadmap for implementation of the Water Code submitted to NWC and approved.

actual.value: Roadmap for implementation of the Water Code submitted to NWC and approved.

title.narrative: Pilot RBCs established and functioning, and basin plans prepared.

target.value: Second pilot RBC formed and basin plan prepared

actual.value: Second pilot RBC formed and basin plan prepared

title.narrative: Number of farmers trained and applying knowledge of improved water management techniques.

actual.value: 30 demo plots created and 600 farmers trained

comment.narrative: No indications yet of farmers applying improved techniques.

title.narrative: Ownership and MOM of minor irrigation schemes transferred to WUAs and WUAFs.

target.value: 24 minor irrigation schemes transferred to WUAs
